thread.title: Khloé Had The Best Response To A Question Victim-Blaming Kim Kardashian
thread.title_full: Khloé Had The Best Response To A Question Victim-Blaming Kim Kardashian

author: Ellie Woodward
title: Khloé Had The Best Response To A Question Victim-Blaming Kim Kardashian
text:
View this image ›
Angela Weiss / AFP / Getty Images Women often suffer misogynistic blame when they’re the victims of a crime, and Kim was no exception. The blame placed on Kim ranged from her not having her bodyguard with her at the time of the robbery, to living a luxurious lifestyle, and “flaunting her wealth” on social media. Plenty of people also suggested she “deserved” the robbery.
ID: 10318952 2. Well, this week, Khloé Kardashian became the first member of the family to fend off questions on this theme. instagram.com
instagram.com
 ID: 10318887 During an interview with Today , Khloé was immediately asked whether the robbery was a “wakeup call” to the family in realising that there were “consequences” for living so “publicly and socially.” View this image ›
today.com ID: 10318831 3. And she wasn’t here for it. ID: 10318906 4. Khloé’s answer against this blaming was concise and A+. View this image ›
today.com She said: “No, I don’t believe that because people show their lives more, that they deserve, or should have consequences like getting robbed.”
ID: 10318836 5. YES KHLOÉ. View this image ›
E! ID: 10318845 6. She went on to say that the whole experience had been “traumatising” for the family. Khloé explained :
It’s traumatising and terrifying, but that’s when you get down on your knees and you pray and you thank the Lord that nothing worse happened.
Via today.com ID: 10318847 7. Khloé also added that the family had felt “relieved” at the news of 15 arrests in relation to the robbery, earlier this week. View this image ›
instagram.com Since the interview, four suspects have been charged .
ID: 10319012 8. In a second interview this week with Extra , Khloé revealed that the new series of Keeping Up With The Kardashians will have a different feel to it, as the family deal with the aftermath of the robbery. View this image ›
extratv.com / Via extratv.com ID: 10318850 She said :
This season it’s different, because there’s so much real – everything’s real – but no one would ever predict the robbery, so there is a lot of that that will be shown. It’s really intense. I wouldn’t say it’s dark, it’s just really intense and serious.
Via extratv.com ID: 10318991 10. Well one thing is for sure: the Kardashians will stick together throughout this process. View this image ›
E! ID: 10319070 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
 More News About Khloe Kardashian, Kim Kardashian Ellie Woodward is a senior celebrity reporter for BuzzFeed and is based in London.
